original_question: Which scientist is credited with saying ‘The one who follows the crowd will usually get further than the crowd.  Those who walk alone are likely to find themselves in places no one has ever been before’?
diverse_qns: Who is the scientist known to have spoken the famous quote about not following the crowd?
Which scientist has been recognized for expressing the idea that following the crowd will get you further than the crowd, but walking alone can lead to uncharted territory?

Can you tell me the name of the scientist who said "The one who follows the crowd will usually get further than the crowd. Those who walk alone are likely to find themselves in places no one has ever been before”?
Who was it of the scientific community that suggested walking alone could lead one to unprecedented destinations?
Who is credited for saying that walking alone could place an individual in unexplored areas?
Do you know the scientist who implied that choosing a different path from the crowd can lead to undiscovered places?
Is there a scientist who has been acknowledged for stating that being unique and walking alone could lead one to undiscovered potential?
Which scientific mind has been acknowledged for the quote about not following the crowd, but rather choosing to walk alone?
Can you mention the scientist given recognition for stating that following the crowd can make you surpass it, but walking alone can lead to unexplored territories?
Who stated that those individuals who don't follow the crowd, but rather walk alone might find themselves in places no one has been before?
